roleset.name: the act of moving away from
roleset.note: LEAVE-V NOTES: This roleset is a reframed version of the motion aspect of the old leave.01 roleset, and leave.04.
LEAVE-N NOTES: Added by Julia to accommodate LV usages, unification. (from leave-n.03)

This roleset is reserved for events involving motion, where arg0 moves away from arg1. Arg0 is often volitional/agentive. Arg0 and arg1 start out together, and then arg0 moves away from arg1. THe motion may be metaphorical, but in all cases, arg0 is the one undergoing metaphorical or physical motion.

example.name: intransitive
example.text: John left.

example.name: all args
example.text: John left Texas for Colorado

example.name: transitive
example.text: This flight leaves Phoenix at midnight.

example.name: place-left as PP
example.text: This flight leaves from Nashville.

example.name: arg2
example.text: President Clinton leaves for Northern Ireland shortly.

example.name: nominal rel, LVC
example.text: I took my leave of Newcastle and set out with Mr. Downes and Mr. Shepherd.

example.name: double object
example.text: John left Mary a collection of run-down clocks.

roleset.name: (cause to) remain, possibly with secondary predication; aspectual leaving
roleset.note: LEAVE-V NOTES: This roleset was reframed for unification, representing part of the former leave-v.01 roleset as well as the former leave-v.06 roleset.
This roleset is reserved for instances that contain secondary predication on arg1. They are generally more abstract/metaphorical than the leave.01 roleset. These are most often abstract.

This roleset is reserved for instances where no motion is occuring. Arg1 is remaining in a pre-held state/location, and either arg0 is a cause of this, or arg0 is a volitional decision-maker, responsible for keeping arg1 in said state/location. Arg0 is not in motion. Arg0 and arg1 do not start in the same place, and then experience a separation. For the instance "He left the money in the bank", this roleset should only be used if the money was already in the bank, and "he" just decided to allow the money to keep sitting there. If he starts out holding the money and drops it off at the bank, or forgets it there, the leave.01 roleset should be used instead.

role.descr: That which causes/chooses for arg1 to remain

example.name: leave-v: secondary predication
example.text: The move left the companies as outside bidders.

example.name: leave-v: secondary predication
example.text: *PRO* Leave me alone!

example.name: leave-v: all args
example.text: An ambitious expansion has left Magna with excess capacity.

example.name: leave-v
example.text: There is [some time]-1 left *-1 before the start of the year 2000
example.arg: before the start of the year 2000

example.name: leave-v: with LOC
example.text: The buyout left about $130 million in the bank.

example.name: leave-v: with CAU
example.text: That leaves only me to blame â€˜cause mama tried.

example.name: leave-v: with TMP
example.text: They can leave *PRO* memorizing word lists until they get to high school.
example.arg: until they get to high school

roleset.name: lack; leave something to be desired

example.text: The taste of some news professionals leaves something to be desired
example.arg: The taste of some news professionals

roleset.name: absence
roleset.note: LEAVE-N NOTES: Based on sentences in nouns-00040. Framed by Katie. (from leave-n.01)

example.name: args 0, 2, LVB
example.text: Jim Gideon, a lean 36-year-old righthander to take a four-month leave from selling insurance in Texas to try out for Mr. Weaver's team
example.arg: Jim Gideon, a lean 36 year old righthander
to try out for Mr. Weaver's team

example.name: args 0 1
example.text: Thus, my shore leave ended early

example.name: args 0, 1
example.text: The receptionist at the adoption agency went on maternity leave

roleset.name: permission
roleset.note: LEAVE-N NOTES: Added by Julia based on nouns-00080. No VNcls. (from former leave-n.02)

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: His leave to enter or remain in the United Kingdom may be limited so as not to extend beyond the period of authorised absence
example.arg: to enter or remain in the United Kingdom

roleset.name: exclude
roleset.note: LEFT-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on SMS. (from left.03-j)

example.name: passive-ish
example.text: We are almost left out of [campus] social activities.

example.name: Quit it!!
example.text: And they would n't leave off *t* arguing and pleading until he had promised .

roleset.name: leave over: cause to remain
roleset.note: LEAVE-V NOTES: Added by Julia based on WSJ. Be careful to distinguish between the VPC and usages where "over" is part of the location. No Vncls. (from former leave-v.08)

roles.note: Most of these probably appear as passives. It is unclear whether benefactives can occur with the active usage. All of the active usages I've seen that appear to include the benefactive should actually be tagged as leave.01, because the "over" is actually part of the location. ex: "he had left the pistol over with the servants at the further side of the great tree".

example.name: passive with benefactive-- use GOL
example.text: And I-1 was left over *trace*-1 with a glass baking dish with some delicious drippings and grease .
example.arg: with a glass baking dish with some delicious drippings and grease

example.name: transitive
example.text: Since you uninstalled Office, if it left over a folder *-1 at the root of the HDD [called MSOCache]-1 , delete the manually.
example.arg: at the root of the HDD

example.name: passive
example.text: Those dividend bulls argue that corporations are in the unusual position of having [plenty of cash]-1 left over *trace*-1 after paying dividends and making capital expenditures .
